body.p: This Journal of Macromarketing special issue on India was guest edited by Alladi Venkatesh of the University of California, Irvine. Alladi has been a long-time supporter of macromarketing education and research and has made a number of significant contributions to the field. The refereed articles in this issue include studies of India’s retail systems, Bollywood, Indian consumer culture, and Indian advertising. Two equally diverse commentaries explore Indian infrastructure and institutions and the “Incredible India” tourism campaign. Finally, a media review of the animated film, Sita Sings the Blues, raises issues of who speaks for cultural productions and controls the rights to images and copyright. The Journal owes Alladi a profound debt of gratitude for putting together such an excellent assemblage of macromarketing thought.

sec.title: Calls for Papers: Special Issues and Conferences
sec.p: Associate Editors Pierre McDonagh (Dublin City University) and Andrea Prothero (University College Dublin) will edit a Journal of Macromarketing special Issue on “Sustainability as Megatrend” to be published in September, 2014. The deadline is February 13, 2013. Also relevant to macromarketers, the 2013 Conference on Historical Analysis and Research in Marketing will be held at Copenhagen Business School. Macromarketing contributors Leighann Neilson (Carleton University) is program chair and proceedings editor and Stefan Schwarzkopf (Copenhagen Business School) is local arrangements chair. The deadline is December 16, 2012. Detailed calls for papers and contact information can be found at the back of this issue.

sec.title: Guide for Submission of Manuscripts
sec.p: The Guide for Submission of Manuscripts is included at the end of this issue. All new manuscripts must be submitted via Manuscript Central: http://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/jmk.
